cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 495 mi E of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Turning west-southwest Tuesday, moving over the north-western Bahamas Wednesday and then west toward the east-central Florida coast Wednesday night before crossing the peninsula and emerging over the north-east Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (near the Volusia/Brevard County area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: east coast of Florida from Volusia/Brevard County Line to Hallandale Beach; Lake Okeechobee; north-western Bahamas. Storm-surge Watch: Altamaha Sound GA to Hallandale Beach FL. Tropical-Storm Watch: Altamaha Sound GA southward to Volusia/Brevard County Line and Hallandale Beach to north of Ocean Reef
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, north-western Bahamas, and portions of the south-east U.S. coast (GA–SC) within 5-day cone
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes—forecast totals of 2–4 in. with isolated 6 in. could reach or exceed 4 in.
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (current surge watch confined to east coast; west-coast/Tampa Bay surge expected <3 ft)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–50 mph) possible late Wednesday night through Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–3 ft possible in Tampa Bay with prolonged on-shore flow as center crosses peninsula
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and possible coastal erosion affecting port approaches and berth operations
